item.description:
If you would like to join us for dinner on Friday, 6:30 PM @ Robinson's Wharf, please let me know asap.  I'll make a reservation for as many as respond. (16 so far!)  And, there will be an acoustic band w/ guitar, fiddle, & standup bass!

Note: Rooms will be assigned for you when you arrive. Please make check-in as easy as possible for the hotel staff.  If there's a problem, it's okay to switch rooms with people afterward as long as everyone agrees.

Bring your kayaks and bikes to this lovely spot on Southport Island for a weekend of paddling, eating, drinking, biking, & sightseeing with friends old and new. (Kayak rentals available from Tidal Transit - info below.) 

Arrive Friday for two nights at the Ocean Gate Inn on beautiful Southport Island, 2 miles from Boothbay Harbor.  They have a private dock for our kayaks and 45 acres of waterfront grounds.  All rooms are in the newly renovated Waterfront Building with a balcony and two double beds. 

The price is for a shared room.  When you RSVP, please indicate whether or not you have a roommate selected already.

Waterfront Building - This building features a premium location just feet from the water, a spectacular ocean view, and private balconies in each room. All rooms in the Waterfront Building have been newly renovated for your enjoyment! Free WIFI available at the Pavilion. No smoking, no pets.

Pay via credit card through the Meetup site.

Payment is due when you RSVP.  I need to send the hotel a large deposit to hold the rooms!

Your spot is not reserved until I receive your payment. 

Price is per person based on double occupancy and includes:

  • 2 nights (Friday-Sunday) shared accommodation (2 double beds) 
  • Full hot buffet breakfast each morning
  • 25” Cable TV with HBO, coffee maker, fridge
  • Private bath, hair dryer, iron/ironing board
  • Outdoor Heated Pool (seasonal)
  • Jacuzzi Spa, Fitness Center
  • Tennis & Basketball Courts, Volleyball, Horseshoe Pits
  • Miniature Golf, Children's Playground, Tetherball
  • Stocked Trout Pond, Games from the Front Desk
  • Picnic and BBQ Area
  • Free local calls / Free daily newspaper

    Note: the resort has a limited # of canoes, kayaks, & row boats available free for guest use. However, these are only available for 2 hrs at a time & are not proper sea kayaks. If you want to paddle with us, rent a boat from Tidal Transit.

    Kayak/Bike Rentals:  Tidal Transit Co., Boothbay Harbor 

  • 10% off all kayak & bicycle rentals and FREE delivery to the Inn when you mention Seacoast Outdoors.

    • Hiking: The Boothbay Region Land Trust manages over 30 miles of trails in the area that are open for hiking.  On their Website, click on "Guides" to find maps of their preserves.  The Trust also manages several islands that we can paddle to.

    Southport Island: Southport is a quiet island below Boothbay Harbor, accessible by a small swing bridge.  There is a great restaurant/pub right on the water,  a quaint general store with an extensive wine collection, and an old town dock at Cape Newagen that looks out over some picturesque islands, a lighthouse, and the sea.

  • Ocean Gate is located at the protected northern end of Southport Island.  This is the coast of Maine so there are numerous islands and coves to explore, abundant wildlife, and fresh lobster and local oysters to enjoy!

    Directions to Ocean Gate:

  • I-95 North to exit 44 for I-295 North
  • I-295 North to Exit 31 - onto the Route 1 connecter in Topsham.
  • Follow Route 1 North, passing Brunswick, Bath, & Wiscasset.
  • As you leave the village of Wiscasset, you cross a bridge.
  • About a mile after the bridge, turn right onto Route 27 South.
  • Continue on Rt. 27, making a sharp right at the stop sign next to the library in the village of Boothbay Harbor (just before Boothbay Harbor shops).
  • Continue on Rt. 27 for 2 more miles, crossing Southport Bridge.
  • Continue on Rt. 27 (bearing right) for 3/10 of a mile and you’ll find the entrance to the Ocean Gate Resort on your right.

You also agree to assume all mental, physical, financial, and/or other risk associated with this meetup. Kayaking, camping, hiking, bicycling, and other activities pose inherent risks and dangers. Participation in these activities is voluntary and dependent upon your own personal judgement.

    As organizer I make no claims regarding any expertise for this outing. I have no special training and have not made this trip before.  -Larry Pilla
item.name: Southport Maine Coastal Weekend!
